posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
D'Alessandro wrote:
(blue = original, red = changed)
pre-epic
06: Shifter(1): Extend Spell Expertise

09: Shifter(4): Empower Spell Extend spell

18: Druid(10): Maximize Spell Empower spell

epic
38: Rogue(6) Shifter (16)

39: Shifter(16) (17): Dragon Shape, Epic prowess, (WIS=31)

40: Shifter(17) Druid (18): WIS+1, (WIS=32) DEX+1 (14)
Your AB needs some serious help so I would glean every AB, if possible, or it will be tough to hit anything. I could only find room for epic prowess to help all forms but when you try to provide shape flexibility as you have, you will usually fall short of attack power in any one form. Basically, when you try to make it a well-rounded build it will never dominate in any area.

Unless you really need Maximize for slot management I would rely on Empower Spell (+2 buffs vs. +3 buffs). Except for feat-glutted Wiz builds I find I seldom need or use Max spell.

Since you only need 30 WIS for Dragon (and though it would get 1 more DC point @WIS 32), if you bump Dex 1 point instead, you will at least get +1AC/+1 refl for those forms that do not overwrite DEX, like Risen Lord.

I find Expertise (and especially Improved Expertise) an awesome feat for all caster types like wyrmlings, raks, mindflayers. etc.. In early levels, that extra 5 or 10 AC really makes a huge difference as it does even with later shapes. I'm not sure how to get the improved form in this build, however. You could get away without IKD if you used forms like minotaur or other large races, but that would be your preference.

I like your skill set a lot but would easily swap at least 15 Search points for Animal Empathy and rely on the commando's Imp Evasion & other special abilities to scout things out in trapland. Plus your INT will help you win checks unless epic traps abound, in which case you might forgo the swap. But for most environments, AE is more useful than high Search skill and just plain more fun.

Finally, there is little to be gained with the 6th rogue level other than a reflex save which, if you swap the WIS for DEX @40 as mentioned earlier, you will get it right back. I would sooner add Druid 18 for the SR and extra slots. So if you move Shifter from 40 to 38 (replacing Rog 6), then take Druid 18 at 40 instead of shifter, you'll be able to max Spellcraft at 42 (perhaps need to juggle other skills a bit) and then with INT modifier (+3) will gain +1saves vs. spells with Spcr of 45... with final split of Dru 18/Shf 17/Rog 5.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
I like the build. This is different from the Druid/Shifter/Monk combo's you typically see. Here are some suggestions.

1. Swap 2 levels of Rogue for 2 levels of Shifter. You'll lose a few skill points but gain 1 bonus feat.
2. As Hip suggests, bump DEX up to 14.
3. Keep WIS at 32 by taking Great Wisdom with the Shifter bonus feat you're now getting.
4. Take Dragon Shape at 36 and Construct Shape at 39. You're getting WIS 30 as a stat bump, not from a feat, so that's legal.

I don't know about the PW you're playing in or your play-style but with the take 20's you get from Open Lock and Disable Trap, you're hitting DC's of 55. That's pretty darn high so losing the extra skill points from 2 Rogue levels shouldn't impact your original intent with this character.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Seems to be maximized pretty good to me.

One minor comment though that doesn't necessitate reposting the build again... Open Locks.

If your server doesn't provide lock picks (generally +10 lock picks are sold and/or drop) then you may need that high level in that skill. In that case, you would know better than I the conditions where you play. But the druid can always Call Lightning or Flame Lash and destroy chests and doors that are difficult to open, avoiding the need for such a high Open Lock level.

I also noticed that in your revisions, somewhere along the line that the Search skill (once maxed) disappeared completely from the build. It would probably be better (except for the custom environment considerations) to swing some of Open Lock points over there. From my own experience, 10-15 points seems sufficient, depending on your play style and how well you use all your forms (commando for scouting, wyrmlings for True Seeing, etc.). You may need to swing even more of them if the trap DCs have been set abnormally high or epic traps abound.

Looks like about the best you can make an all-purpose shifter build as it stands. Congrats and start testing it!
